Organization: People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals
Request Description: Copies of the following public records dating from January 1, 2008 to the present: 1. Any memorandum, report, evaluation, assessment, determination, investigation, study or communication regarding the testing or surveillance program designed to prevent the spread of Bovine Spongiform Encephalopathy (BSE); 2. Any memorandum, report, evaluation, assessment, determination, investigation, study or communication relating to, or substantiating, the claim made by the USDA that a surveillance program exists that allows USDA to detect the BSE disease in the U.S. cattle population; 3. Any memorandum, report, evaluation, assessment, determination, investigation, study or communication relating to, or substantiating, the claim made by the USDA concerning an "interlocking system of safeguards" that prevents BSE; 4. Any memorandum, report, evaluation, assessment, determination, investigation, study or communication relating to the effectiveness (or vulnerability and/or ineffectiveness) of the BSE surveillance program or "interlocking system of safeguards" referenced, among other things, by the USDA Chief Veterinary Officer; 5. Any memorandum, report, evaluation, assessment, determination, investigation, study, or communication relating to the samples taken as part of the BS surveillance program referenced, among other things, by the USDA Chief Veterinary Officer; 6. Any memorandum, report, evaluation, assessment, determination, investigation, study, or communication relating to the BSE sampling procedure referenced, among other things, by the USDA Chief Veterinary Officer; 7. Any memorandum, report, evaluation, assessment, determination, investigation, study or communication relating to the "groups where the (BSE) disease is more likely to be found: 8. Any memorandum, report, evaluation, assessment, determination, investigation, study or communication relating to the "targeted population for ongoing [BSE] surveillance" referenced, among other things, by the USDA Chief Veterinary Officer; 9. Any memorandum, report, evaluation, assessment, determination, investigation, study or communication relating to cattle exhibiting signs of central nervous disorders or signs associated with BSE, referenced, among other things, by the USDA Chief Veterinary Officer; 10. Any memorandum, report, evaluation, assessment, determination, investigation, study or communication relating to "samples from farms, veterinary diagnostic laboratories, public health laboratories, slaughter facilities, veterinary clinics, and livestock markets" referenced, among other things, by the USDA Chief Veterinary Officer; 11. Any memorandum, report, evaluation, assessment, determination, investigation, study or communication relating to the determination of the USDA that the animal found positive for BSE on or about April 23, 2012, had "a very rare form of the disease not generally associated with an animal consuming infected feed," referenced, among other things, by the USDA Chief Veterinary Officer; 12. All communications between USDA and "international laboratories with more experience with this atypical form of BSE" referenced, among other things, by the USDA Veterinary Officer; 13. All records relating to the investigation of the animal found positive for BSE on or about April 23, 2012.
